content.question: The model shown in the figure represents the role of two hormones, calcitonin and parathyroid hormone (PTH), in maintaining normal blood calcium levels in humans. If a dietary change results in an increase in blood calcium concentration above normal levels, which of the following is the most likely effect on calcium homeostasis?

choices.label: Calcitonin levels will decline, thus stimulating the release of PTH.
Calcitonin levels will rise, thus promoting the deposit of calcium into bones.
PTH levels will decline, thus stimulating the loss of calcium from bones.
PTH levels will increase, thus preventing the release of calcitonin.

content.answer: Calcitonin levels will rise, thus promoting the deposit of calcium into bones.

skill.text: 2.C: Explain how biological models relate to larger principles, concepts, processes, systems, or theories.
